etymology.description: Depicts bones -> original form of 骨(骨) (gǔ, "bone")
etymology.interpretation: The character 冎 is a pictogram representing bones and serves as the original form of 骨(骨) (gǔ, "bone"). Its depiction captures the outline of bones, highlighting its usage in ancient scripts. It also appears in other characters as a component, maintaining its essence related to structure and form.

examples.chinese: 这个汉字由偏旁和冎构成(這個漢字由偏旁和冎構成)，其中冎提供了语音线索(其中冎提供了語音線索)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège hànzì yóu piānpáng hé guǒ gòuchéng, qízhōng guǒ tígōng le yǔyīn xiànsuǒ.
examples.english: This character is composed of radicals and guǒ, wherein guǒ provides a phonetic clue.

examples.chinese: 在古代造字过程中(在古代造字過程中)，冎常作为声旁使用(冎常作為聲旁使用)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔdài zàozì guòchéng zhōng, guǒ cháng zuòwéi shēngpáng shǐyòng.
examples.english: In the process of character creation in ancient times, guǒ was often used as a phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 冎是一种发音提示符(冎是一種發音提示符)。
examples.pinyin: Guǒ shì yī zhǒng fāyīn tíshì fú.
